meanings.definition: The next to last syllable in a word.
meanings.sent1: In the word 'elephant', the penultima is 'phant'.
meanings.sent2: She struggled to pronounce the penultima of the word 'hippopotamus'.
meanings.sent3: The penultima of 'banana' always trips me up during spelling bees.
meanings.sent4: Finding the penultima in a complex word is like solving a puzzle.
meanings.sent5: Remembering the penultima can help you spell words correctly.

meanings.definition: The second to last item in a series.
meanings.sent1: The penultima in the list of groceries was milk.
meanings.sent2: He always saves the penultima cookie for last.
meanings.sent3: Forgetting the penultima ingredient when baking can be disastrous.
meanings.sent4: The penultima chapter of the book left readers in suspense.
meanings.sent5: The penultima song in the concert was the crowd's favorite.

meanings.definition: The penultimate day of the month.
meanings.sent1: On the penultima of December, people prepare for New Year's Eve.
meanings.sent2: She always plans a special dinner on the penultima of the month.
meanings.sent3: The penultima of the month is a time for reflection and anticipation.
meanings.sent4: The penultima of the month signals the end of one chapter and the beginning of another.
meanings.sent5: The penultima of the month is a busy time for many people.
